intro: Allosorus raddeanus, commonly known as the mountain helleborine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of East Asia, including China, Korea, and Japan. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and its showy, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Allosorus raddeanus is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
